text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to refer to Section 2(3) of the Arbitration Act 1996 when considering whether it is appropriate for the court to act. The candidate answer refers to Section 44 of the Arbitration Act 1996, which deals with the court's power to grant interim measures in support of arbitral proceedings, but it fails to mention Section 2(3), which addresses the general principle of non-intervention by the court in arbitral matters.", "criterion_id": "27a7166e-59ca-4a59-8eb6-7e17bb61462f"}
